TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed Platform extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the bits-per-word of the process in which an out-of-process add-in is run.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows how the enumeration value affects the bits-per-word of the process on different operating systems:
||32-bit operating system|64-bit operating system| |-|------------------------------|------------------------------| |Host|32-bit|Same as host process| |AnyCPU|32-bit|64-bit| |X86|32-bit|32-bit| |X64|Exception is thrown|64-bit| ||32-bit|N/A|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.AddIn.Hosting.Platform AnyCpu = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The add-in is loaded into an external process with the same bits-per-word as the operating system.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.AddIn.Hosting.Platform ARM = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The add-in is loaded into a 32-bit process on an ARM processor.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.AddIn.Hosting.Platform Host = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The add-in is loaded into an external process with the same bits-per-word as the host process.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.AddIn.Hosting.Platform X64 = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The add-in is loaded into a 64-bit external process.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.AddIn.Hosting.Platform X86 = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The add-in is loaded into a 32-bit external process.
